--- title: "Built up area" format: html --- ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-6} **Name:** Built up area **Source:** [GHSL - Global Human Settlement Layer](https://doi.org/10.2905/9F06F36F-4B11-47EC-ABB0-4F8B7B1D72EA) **Version:** 1 **Keywords:** buildings, land use **Type:** Raster **Description:** The spatial raster dataset depicts the distribution of built-up surfaces, expressed as number of square metres. The data report about the total built-up surface and the built-up surface allocated to dominant non-residential (NRES) uses. Data are spatial-temporal interpolated or extrapolated from 1975 to 2030 in 5 years intervals. For the temporal anchor point of 2018 the data is published at 10m as observed from the S2 image data. **Units:** m^2 **Available in geocoded GMD?** No **Available from Space2Stats?** No ::: ::: {.g-col-6} **Map** ::: {.cell} ::: **Coordinate reference system:** World Mollweide (EPSG:54009) or WGS84 (EPSG:4326) **Spatial coverage:** Global **Spatial resolution:** 10 m, 100 m, 1 km, 3 arcsec or 30 arcsec **Temporal coverage:** 1975-2030 **Temporal resolution:** 5-year intervals **License:** CC BY 4.0 **Citation:** Pesaresi M., Politis P. (2023): GHS-BUILT-S R2023A - GHS built-up surface grid, derived from Sentinel2 composite and Landsat, multitemporal (1975-2030)European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC) PID: http://data.europa.eu/89h/9f06f36f-4b11-47ec-abb0-4f8b7b1d72ea, doi:10.2905/9F06F36F-4B11-47EC-ABB0-4F8B7B1D72EA ::: ::: ::::::: grid ::: {.g-col-lg-8 .g-col-lg-offset-2 .g-col-md-10 .g-col-md-offset-1 .g-col-sm-12 .g-col-12} **Usage:** NA **Limitations:** NA **Examples:** NA **Access:** GHS-BUILT-S data files are available for direct download [here](https://human-settlement.emergency.copernicus.eu/download.php?ds=bu). The gridded data (.tif format) can be downloaded as a single global file for either Residential (RES) or non residential (NRES) classification. It is also available in smaller tiles covering a specific area - see the website. There is a separate file for each 5-year epoch, coordinate reference system and spatial resolution available. The code below downloads and opens the data using R. ::: panel-tabset ## R No code ## Output ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "None" ``` ::: ::: ::: **Last updated:** 10/17/25 ::: ::::::: ```{=html}
